thread.title: Hyderabad made decent start against Goa in Ranji Trophy opener
thread.title_full: Hyderabad made decent start against Goa in Ranji Trophy opener - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Hyderabad made decent start against Goa in Ranji Trophy opener
text:
PORVORIM: Hyderabad got off to a decent start on the first day of their opening Group C Ranji Trophy match against Goa at the Goa Cricket Association ground on Thursday.
Asked to bat, the visitors posted 246 for five before the day's proceeding was called off early due to rains with 21 overs still remaining to be completed.
Electing to bowl, Goa got an early break-through when medium pacer Rituraj Singh dismissed opener Tanmay Agarwal (14) with the visitor's score at 25.
But skipper Hanuma Vihari (82) and other opener Akshath Reddy (61) then steadied Hyderabad innings with a 113-run second wicket partnership.
While Vihari struck 11 boundaries during his 165-ball knock, Reddy decirated his 118-ball innings with 10 hits to the fence.
The partnership was eventually broken by spinner Shadab Jakati, who caught Reddy of his own bowling.
Vihari, in the meantime, completed his half century but became Rituraj's second victim of the day just 18 runs short of his century.
Hyderabad also lost two quick wickets in the form of Bavanaka Sandeep (22) and A Ashish Reddy (8).
Hyderabad were dealt another setback when wicketkeeper Habeeb Ahmed got injured and had to retire hurt on 5, before bad light and rains drew premature curtains to the day's proceedings.
Balchander Anirudh (24) and Akash Bhandari (15) were at the crease when play stopped.
For Goa, Rituraj (2/52) clinched two wickets while Jakati and Amit Yadav picked up a wicket each.
Brief Scores:
Hyderabad 1st innings: 246 for five in 69 overs (Hanuma Vihari 82, Akshath Reddy 61; Rituraj Singh 2/52).
